result.execSummary:
The defendant Henry P Wrzinski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Henry P Wrzinski

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: MARQUETTE COUNTY DNA PROOF OF SUBMISSION

Defendant Henry P Wrzinski in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that he did meet with the defendant and an offer was provided.    Atty Hendee states plea agreement. Defendant agrees.  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.    Defendant waives their right to an attorney.    Defendant enters a No Contest plea.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty.

Atty Hendee asks the court to follow the joint recommendation.

BY THE COURT:  Court Costs = $243.00
  DNA Sample + $200.00 Surcharge
60 days to pay

Pre-trial conference at 01-26-2016 09:45 am.
Return date at 02-18-2016 03:30 pm.

with conditions:
*Appear for booking within 48 hours

Defendant Henry P Wrzinski in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Atty Hendee states that bond needs to be set along with booking.
  Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant understands.  Court finds probable cause to support the charges.

  BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.

  Atty Hendee has no objection to a signature bond with conditions.
  BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $500 Signature bond with conditions:
*Appear for booking within 48 hours

Court questions the defendant.    Defendant waives their right to an attorney in order to have a conference with the District Attorney. 
BY THE COURT:  Set for Return and pre-trial.  Return date scheduled for February 18, 2016 at 03:30 pm.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 26, 2016 at 09:45 am.
